description: While not always used as a UTM parameter, this can represent traffic from organic search results.
name: Search

description: This medium is used for paid search advertising campaigns where you pay each time someone clicks on your ad. It's typically associated with platforms like Google Ads or Bing Ads
name: SearchP

description: This medium is used for organic (unpaid) social media traffic. It covers posts, shares, or profile links from platforms like Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, or Instagram.
name: Social

description: Used to distinguish paid social media advertising from organic social media traffic.
name: SocialP

description: Used for traffic coming from email marketing campaigns. This could include newsletters, promotional emails, or transactional emails.
name: Email

description: This medium is used for display advertising, which includes banner ads, rich media ads, or other visual advertisements placed on websites.
name: Display

description: Used for traffic coming from (third party) affiliate marketing programs where partners promote your products or services with typically a cash based reward structure.
name: Affiliate

description: This medium is used for traffic coming from customer who promote your products and services to people they know or from partners based on trust, excluding paid placements.
name: Referral

description: This medium is used when your content is republished on other websites or platforms.
name: Content Syndication

description: For traffic coming from mobile push notifications.
name: Push

description: For traffic coming from text message marketing.
name: SMS
